review: This review is for the BAR and Happy Hour. Ok, ok, I know I am definitely biased. My roommates and I come here around twice a month because it's close to our house and has a pretty good happy hour. The bartenders are SO nice and will always make you something special. Sometimes it gets really crowded, but usually we can find seats at the bar (there can be up to 4 of us that go) if no seats at the bar, we can always find a table in the bar area. When they have the 2 for $10 or 3 courses special it's perfect to share and a great deal.  With that being said, YES it is a TGIFridays. So...could they have healthier options? Sure. We would love that sometimes. But the bartenders and staff here are so great I just can't knock a star off.

i Went there last night to have dinner with my wife and the service was horrible. The waitress was prompt on the first set of drinks and appetizers but from there on out she would ignore us. We got our food about 30 min after we recieved our appetizer only to have my pasta served cold. I asked her to please have the cooks warm it up, so she took it too the back and I didnt ever get my food back after that. By the time my wife finished eating I wasnt even hungry anymore so I politely told her to not worry about it and to take it off the check. She took another 10 minutes to do that I then gave her my card to charge which took another 10 minutes. During the time I asked her to have the cooks warm up the food she would help every other customer except us, from bringing them new drinks to there entreee as well. After all this I login to my back account and see that she charged me 15.00 extra on a $20.00 tab. I will be returning today to speak to the manager.

I'm only giving this place three stars because Sequoia, my waitress, was pretty attentive and very much on point!  Apparently, they thought it a good idea to have trivia night during one of the Laker games(2/23) *bright*  Anyway, the trivia dude sucked. He was very dry, and didn't seem happy to be working.  Lucky me, I got to sit right next to him...and his speakers. :-/  As for the atmosphere, it was a lot less crowded for me b/c I came in at the tale end of happy hour.  However, if you are planning on getting in at the bar/bar area(which is the ONLY place the happy hour prices apply), you'd better plan on getting there right at the beginning (4-7)   It's a great place to watch a game.  Plenty of tv's.  The drinks are nicely priced, with a healthy amount of alcohol.  I didn't get any food this particular night, but I usually can't complain.  Guess it all depends on what you're in the mood for....*definitely wasn't in the mood for a dry-ass trivia dude in my ear, that's for sure*.

It took 2 hours for lunch! I have been here a few times with my coworkers. There is a girl there who is a bartender and works the high tops during lunch on most days for at least the past year. I think her name is Ayana (her name was on my last check but I know some places bartenders will only clock in under 1 name). She is truly the worst server EVER. As I have mentioned in my past reviews, I have worked as a server and I am pretty understanding because people have off days. Ayana always comes to the table after a good 5-10 minutes after you sit down. She NEVER smiles and always looks like she hates that fact that you are there eating and bothering her. She takes forever and always forgets at least 1 thing.  Last time I went she charged me for a soda that I didn't get and completely forgot that I ordered desert. Worse is when I went up to her, she didn't even apologize for her mistake! Hey, you made the mistake not me. The MOST DISGUSTING thing that she did, which made me write this review, is she was rubbing her eye the WHOLE TIME she was talking to me when she brought me my new check. DISGUSTING! Something was wrong with her right eye and it was like shut, but she kept rubbing it. This is a BIG no no and totally grossed me out. And she never got me my dessert, I had to ask the manager to bring it out. WORST WAITRESS/BARTENDER EVER!

I have found that you will get better service if you are willing to at the bar. If you sit at a table you can wait forever it seems, for someone to come and take your order and then bring out your food.  To me it just seems like me and my friends have always received more attention from whoever is working at the bar. Not only that, the drinks are better than the food and there is TV around there also so you can watch while waiting for your food.

I ate here with my mom the day after my 22nd birthday , also April 5 the day before I got married and received the same crappy waiter , the day after my birthday I just had enough , I came in around 1 and it wasn't crowded by 1:30 the lunch time rush came in , that acceptable , but not receiving drinks or refills , or even appetizers( had to get my appetizer remade was cold you could tell it was sitting in the back for awhile) was unacceptable there was a nice hostess who works the front door that helped us Ronald Howard I think his name was , well after complaining to the manager about the service I received twice with the same person he nicely comped my food and even alcoholic beverages and even gave me a 25$ return card to come again, don't no if I will be going back . But you can't turn down a free meal .. Thanks Ron for helping us out , I would probably still be sitting there hungry if it wasn't for you
I had a great time. Party of 12 and the one waitress was on point the whole time, with drinks and food. And the 2 for 10 is not a bad deal. Ended up taking my food home

Service was good, meals were fresh and well portioned. We ate here twice dinner with steaks and dinner were hot and delivered promptly. Another trip for lunch consisted of salads and pasta, and was equally good and fresh.
Servers are great...they know the menu well. Service is great...food is mostly average

I'll try to start on a positive note! :)  The waiter was friendly and good considering the circumstances.  The Silver Spring location was extremely busy due to the power outage.  I ordered the Pan-Seared Parmesan Flounder.  I think they forgot to add the flounder, all I got was a overcooked pile of burnt parmesan breading.  My rating was solo based on the Pan-Seared Parmesan Flounder.  My husband ordered the ribs and they were really good.  My advice, stay clear of the Pan-Seared Parmesan Flounder (or make sure you tell the waiter/waitress to add the flounder), order the ribs and you will not be disappointed!

Food was eh.  We told the waitress to split the check, and she was so stupid, she charged us both the FULL amount.  So it was $80 bucks a piece.  She could not admit to it and sent the manager over who tried to make us feel better for initially paying $160 for some cheap bar food and a few drinks.  Almost a week later I finally get half my money back.

Ive been here several times and sat at the bar and dining area. Bar experiences have always been good, they have always been busy at the bar area. The dining area has been a little slow at times but still okay. The food is standard to TGIF. Sometimes the food does look a little old and lazily put together. I think they should try to get the cooks to pay attention to orders (read reviews of orders being made wrong) and presentation.  I'm giving this place two starts because of the food. My sister has a very mild shrimp allergy. She ordered the chicken and shrimp Alfredo without the shrimp, she always orders Alfredo everywhere she goes. Seemed easy enough but when the food arrived it came with shrimp. Because she had a very mild allergy she was able to pluck the small shrimps out of her dish and discard them. I actually ate a shrimp and I wasn't sure if it was cooked or not.. Scary. We aren't the type to complain at allll so we just went on with out meal. The manager came over semi frantically to ask how was everything. It seemed like he may have known they messed up. Being the non confrontational customer that my sister was, she just said yeah it was fine. If she had a severe allergy to shrimp or nuts or something and didn't see it and ate it they would have been in bigggggg trouble. My sister, and TGIF, lucked out that this wasn't a huge problem.

Visited here several times, pretty good wait staff and food. Can't beat the specials they have 2 for $10 appitizer and entree, plenty of drinks and laid back environment. Their menu is constanty evolving, new food and drink selections!

DO NOT EAT HERE! I think the only reason this location stays in business is because of the popularity of the name. Slowest service ever accompanied by overpriced bland american food at its worst.  I am sure you can find something decent on the menu but the prices will not match and the service will have you feeling as though the meal should have been on them.  Our waitress had no idea about any the drinks or foods we asked her about-she stated to us she had been working there for 4yrs-that was no big deal-we let that slide BUT it took her 45minutes to bring water and oops she forgot the water and just brought a glass with ice in it.  She let us know she would be right back with a bottled water..she came back with a soda for my friend and forgot the water.  Half an hour after that..the bottled water arrived around the same time the food did-after appetizers and all-she forgot all the substitudes on the main meals we asked for.  She brought every meal out at different times.  As you looked around -it was the laziest slowest service all around I have ever seen.  Management needs to step up here.  The 6.00 bowl of soup is about 3-4 slurps.  You would think the portion would be bigger than the side soup but its the same.  The french onion soup tasted like salt soup with canned onions dumped in and a clump of processed cheese attempted to be melted on top.  Go down the street to Panera bread and less you will get a bowl three times the size with more quality ingredients.  HORRIBLE FRIDAYS LOCATION!  My co-workers have eaten here many times since its the only thing around and they complain about it every time after coming back to work.  IT WILL TAKE HOURS FOR YOUR FOOD TO ARRIVE!

The two stars are an aggregate of my experiences here because I've never had a bad time as I did a few nights ago. It was the typical evening crowd - pretty packed, but not really. Our server took our orders, but didn't bother to write them down. That was a warning sign for me; I've found that servers who don't write orders bring out bad orders (obviously) or just try too hard to seem as if they know everything. Both are terrible in my book. Sure enough, when everything came out - after about 20 minutes - they got my dad's order wrong. The guy who brought it out took it back but nothing happened until our server came around 10 minutes later to apologize. We waited around another 15 minutes for the correct entree to come out. Once we got the check, I saw that they had still charged us for the wrong entree!  Let me say here that the last time a server got my order wrong, she didn't charge us for a drink as a way of making it up. This guy didn't even try to make such amends, and instead still left the incorrect order on there. I was already planning on leaving no tip, but this made it even easier. I honestly wanted to skip paying for an iced tea as well...
Always a great experience at Fridays, haven't been to this location in over a year, just disappointed there is no DJ here on Fridays anymore.

Usually I love going to TGIF just to chill and have some drinks, but this was the first time I've been to this particular location. The silver springs location is pretty dead, boring and on top of that the SERVICE sucks. If it wasn't for the convenience of my friend that I went with I would've left and go to another location. I WOULDN'T recommend this location to anyone. An DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT get OP as your bartender!!!!!!

Go here for a steak.. I think TGIF is a bit expensive, unless you get a special of some sort, but their steaks are really good and usually cooked to my taste. I've had a few other items off the menu, that's good. We live around the corner, so we have eaten here many many times and for how many times we have been here, we for the most part have had a great experience. The staff is really friendly, and there isn't a weird vibe or nothing. Relaxed, and the drinks are yummy as well. I recommend this Fridays, it's not off the chain like Rockville, but at times it is, but it's good if you just want to go out on a Friday night and chill. I personally do like Ruby's a little more, because they throw in the salad bar and it's a bit more quiet, especially if you are on a date... but Fridays is around the corner and I recommend it.

The food at this location is better than Greenbelt, so we go here.  Most of the servers are nice and good enough, but we had one recently, short black female, very rude and inattentive.  Most times I go there I get a 4 experience, the prospect of getting her once in a while makes it a 3

Good experience.  Waited in the entry for a while for my companion to show, and observed the hosts/servers during that time.  VERY YOUNG - were told by the manager to behave better, but didn't really help.   The server was friendly and upbeat.  Unfortunately, the Blue Moon beer did not come with its orange slice, and the potato skins that we requested without bacon came with indentations of the bacon.  But otherwise, content with the service.

This place is somewhat of a hidden gem, without the gem part.  It's nestled off the side of Rte. 29, so it was years before I even knew it was here. let alone part of the convenient shopping center.  That's kind of where it ends, though. First, the service is lacking. I've come here during a quiet Friday afternoon when the place was nearly empty and had the same inattentive service I've had on a hopping Friday night. Additionally, the servers aren't as polished as I'd expect. I still expect a certain level of service and quality to my interactions with people, regardless of what they might assume about me.  I much prefer sitting at the bar area, which has an interesting set-up. The bar itself is in the middle of the room with the tables forming a horseshoe around it. It can be a bit awkward because you feel like if you look across the room you're staring at another table, but I think it offers a good measure of privacy among the parties on your side of room. The food is standard -- it's Fridays.  I haven't had any terrible or amazing things to report about the food because I expect a baseline of quality that is usually hard to miss.   Apparently they offer karaoke on Wednesdays ... sounds entertaining, but I think I'll pass.

The stars are purely for the young lady who was a wait staff - she was attentive, pleasant, and friendly. If you looked up as if you needed something, she acknowledges you -- a few times I said "oh I didn't need anything, I was just looking up and our eyes met". She surveyed the table and will fill whatever drinks we had without us asking. We wanted for nothing.  We closed down the restaurant side of the TGI Fridays and our wait staff said "we are closing this side but you are more than welcome to transition to our bar section". We left her a big tip just because she was a good steward.  I order a hot tea and a dessert; however, my friends order dinner... they enjoyed their food also - no one had to return their order.

Co-workers and I, retired and those still working, meet here every other month to socialize.  The food is typical TGIFriday fare.  It is good.  I am writing this particularly because of the amazingly friendly atmosphere at this Tech Road establishment.   I often wonder what it takes for Management to foster a pleasant environment for customers AND EMPLOYEES.  This place has hit that sweet spot and they do it over and over and over.  I take my hat off to the Tech Road mgmt.  They got it right.  And the employees are always welcoming.  It is a pleasure to eat there.  Plenty of options around that area.  I will always choose this TGIFridays when in the area. This is the TGIFridays at Tech Road in Silver Spring, Md.

Well let me see, the door man/host if he's even capable of that job lacked maturity especially when he just assumed I wasn't part of the party of 5. Seemed to have attitude and we are the paying customers, disgusting. Some of the other employees lacked professionalism, then again it's a Franchised location. Our waitress is really what earned the stars with her pleasant attitude and competence with pretty much every request we made. The only thing I am disappointed in with her is that even after giving her my phone #, she forgot to add the stripes. Well that's 70 stripes I will never see. I am definitely thinking twice before I visit this location again, I enjoy Rockville much better. On the plus side, they know how to make a good drink.

I mean I know it's Friday's, but the food was below average even for this chain restaurant. The chicken breasts on my meal were burnt...and my sizzling chicken and shrimp came out cold....really? My cousins petite sirloin was cooked to a crisp...I don't expect five star meals, but edible would be nice.
The food was okay and my steak was cooked well. The srevice was pretty good especially since we had a large group.

Went to TGIF's for a company dinner.  We had a large party but the service was quite slow.  Had to ask several times for refills and then wait for the drinks to come.  We did have 2 servers for our table, but they didn't seem to be able keep up with our requests.  Food was just OK, typical chain food.  Would probably find somewhere else to eat the next time I stay in this area.

I came here with colleagues as a group of 10. I thought lunch came out a little slow since most of us ordered salads. Surprisingly, the people in our group who didn't order salads received their sandwiches and hot food quicker than we did. I thought my grilled chicken cobb salad was great; I don't like blue cheese but went with it anyway in the salad.  Service is kind of weird. Our server was hard to hear and the others were a little too weirdly enthusiastic.  At least we were able to get seated quickly.

Not bad, but not good either. Maybe because it was late, and maybe individuals wanted to go home, and just maybe because it was a holiday weekend, I don't know? But my experience here was just a little bit under okay. Food was cool, it was the service that was only subpar: Dude did a decent job with him having to cover lots of tables and the bar. But it was the other bar tender that messed up the deal. She was somewhat rude but somehow was able to combine rude and customer service in one, I guess you could call it "sarcasm," and being sarcastic in customer service is something in my opinion that is not needed. Wow, this was a tough review for me.. My advice, proceed with caution!

I would like to congratulate this TGI Friday's for having the WORST customer service of any chain restaurant that I've ever experienced. Just god-awful service. The waiters are slow, untrained and lack the social skills that most people in their field possess. If you ever find yourself at this TGI's location, you'll find it obvious that the staff is inexperienced and poorly managed. The wait staff is always fooling around constantly, while many are waiting long periods of time for their orders. Don't even think about ordering food to go by phone, you'll be there for hours because they'll forget about you. This was the third time I've been burned by this place, and I'm never going to return. The most shocking thing about this restaurant is how it gets any business.

I'm not sure if I entered a restaurant or night club. I entered the restaurant around 9:30 PM after a long day at work. I was by myself so I just went straight for the bar for a quick bite to eat. The music was blaring through the cheap ceiling speakers. I say cheap because they couldn't handle the heavy bass of the music and sounded strained. Normally I wouldn't care but tonight I was tired and not in the mood to have to yell my order to the waitress because the music was so loud. I've never been to a TGIF's that operated this way. Service was terrible. It took 15 minutes to get my beer from the time I gave my order to the waitress. It was surprisingly packed but it's almost like a social club than restaurant. Maybe because this town doesn't have much to offer in the way of an alternative night life to D.C. and TGIF is convenient. Whatever, just get me my Jack Daniels burger, I'll eat in peace, and never come back to this TGIF location again.

Wow, the bad reviews were right.  I walked in on a very snowy Thursday around 5pm.  The bar had quit a few people.  I went up to the bartender and asked about the happy hour specials and she said no happy hour today!?!?! She seemed rather confused by that too.  She double checked with the manager and he very rudely approached the bar, making no eye contact and told her no happy hour on any drink.  Offered no explanation or apologies and walked off.  This is my first one star review, and it was earned by the manager.

I've learned to loosen up and not expect much from chains in order to have a good time. There's only so much a place with a bike on the wall can do.  On a slow Saturday afternoon, we pretty much had the place to ourselves. Our server was really nice and took our orders promptly, and checked on us 3-4 times throughout the meal.  My Jack Daniels chicken sandwich is a fat girl's dream, with cheese, bacon, and onion straws. I thought it was decent, even if the chicken breast was kinda small. Oh and the honey mustard sauce turned the bun into a soggy mess. But the French fries were crisp and seasoned perfectly with salt and pepper.  The hostess was also nice, opening the door for us on the way in, and then smiling and thanking us on the way out.

I wish there was a way to give a zero star review. Two coworkers and I were in the area and decided to stop by for lunch. It was around noon and the restaurant did not appear very busy ( there were empty booths and tables). When we arrived we were asked to wait. OK we waited about ten minutes while two workers stood at the hostess stand talking then they finally said "oh are you ready to be seated"? We were ready when we came in. Once we were seated no one came by to take our order or give us menus. My coworker asked someone where our waiter was and he said she would be there in a minute. By this time its been another ten minutes and we decided just to leave rather than wait place an order and have the food take forever. I'll never come here again.

This is about fries and why they matter. I begin with a confession:  TGIF's Sedona black bean burger is one of my top vegetarian indulgences.  It's really good!  Really! And this from the folks who bring you Jack Daniels branded ribs!  I'm awfully grateful that TGIF brings its A-game to the vegetarian options. I've been to this location more than any other and have had a wide variety of strange service occurrences, everything from orders not being right to no silverware to inaccurate checks.  So there's a good bit of disorganization here, but frankly everyone has been nice and nothing was ever really a problem. I've noticed the amount of fries has decreased over time.  This to me is more serious. Consider:  big chains have some really large margins.  Think about the spread they earn on non-alcoholic drinks alone.  The prices here are inching high-ward and that's okay so long as they are otherwise generous with the customer experience.  For example, it's more okay to charge $3 for a soda if it has free refills, even if you don't get $3 worth, because it gives you the option to have more of what you enjoy. Fries are cheap.  TGIF is not increasing its margins all that much by skimping.  Yes I know that with their volume the little things matter.  But it reveals that they're nickel and diming me.  Fry quantity is a sign of good faith -- it says, yes, we're making a profit here, but you're not going to leave wanting more of this really cheap thing that you enjoy. Skimping on fries is subtracting quite a bit of enjoyment on my part for a very small increase in their profit.  Bad move.

I am a business traveler and like to visit the big chain restaurants every now and than. I have come her three times so far and always sit at the bar. The food is exactly what you would expect at a chain restaurant so I can't say anything bad about what I have ordered.  However, I will say they could do better on their service.  It is not that it was so bad that I wouldn't come back but, it does teeter on a 2 to 3 star rating.  If it wasn't for the bartenders genuine and friendly personality I would have given them a 2 star.  I would suggest a better managerial approach because it seems like the staff is always in a panic or on the brink of chaos. Simply stated, there is no management organization.  Fix that and you would have a 4 to 5 star rating.

The one star is because the manager was nice.  I'll keep it short and sweet. I don't have high expectations for chain restaurants to begin with.  We waited 30 minutes for drinks (one glass of wine and a mojito). We waited 40 minutes and his food came out cold. My food came out after an hour wait - 20 mins after his did. We only ordered appetizers.  We left and went someplace where we could actually get our food.  Oh. I also saw one of the busboys wipe the seats and then wipe the table with the same wipe. I know it happens but I hate to see it when my food is put on the table.  Disappointing.

The service is VERY slow, shows a lot when you hear the table next to you is getting a full refund waiting 1 HOUR for an entree. The food was good, I always eat the ribs. The server Ronnie (sp?), despite being new, had one of the best personalities I've ever encountered. If it weren't for his attitude, my overall rating would be a 1. Am not coming here again.

Literally every time I come here it is a disaster. I want to say "haha jk", but I have been here maybe four or five times and each time a tiny little piece of me dies. The staff is mainly teenagers and nobody seems to take much seriously. I guess because every day is Friday there. Basically, the underlying problem at this location, for me, has always been a strong lack of discipline with the staff and really poor situation management. One time, we made a reservation over the phone with a hostess for our friends birthday. Inexplicably, he wanted to go to TGI Fridays to celebrate. We arrived only to find out from (presumably) a different hostess that they don't take reservations, and that we don't know what we're talking about. Yeah, we must have called the Fridays in an alternate dimension where the staff knows what they are doing. They ended up seating the ten of us at two separate booths with a giant wall between them. We were forced to split our group in two. What a fun way to celebrate a birthday, by dividing their loved ones in half and shoving them into a couple of poorly cleaned booths. No apology for the inconvenience, no manager to calm us down- just the unrelentingly average experience of Fridays, with half as many people to commiserate with. Also, why can I not order a burger that isn't well done? Do their microwaves not have a setting for medium-rare? Incorrect food orders happens every time I go. I'm not one of those people who makes it a point to tell the server how "every time I come here they get my order wrong" because it probably won't stop them from screwing it up, and will probably just make them feel too awkward to come check on you after they inevitably screw your order up anyway. It really happens every time though. Probably the most fun part of coming to this restaurant is betting on which part of the meal they will get wrong, and having everybody win the bet because they mess up every course. This place is probably perfect for a younger crowd who hasn't figured out that you get what you pay for. If you just turned 21 and your overpriced Long Island is more important to you than your service or the quality of your food, this is definitely where you want to be. Not only are the Long Islands way overpriced, but those other two things don't even exist here.  The best thing I can say about this restaurant is that they stopped coloring all over their uniforms with glitter pens. On the downside, now you can't tell immediately after walking in how immature and undisciplined this place is. You'll have to take a few steps over to the hostess stand to figure that out.

This Fridays location has been a good choice the few times I have been here with my family or on a date night. New menu items and affordable food make it work.  It was perfect for our Father's Day "lunner" aka late lunch+dinner per my sister. Most other options required reservations or would have had long waits.  Efficient wait staff can make or break a good dining out experience. Our server was excellent with how he handled our table and others in his section. He triple checked orders and followed up after dishes came out.  Our food was mostly at the correct temperature. Some were too hot and to wait to cool off.  Great experience in terms of service and menu choices. We will be back and if you haven't been here yet, try it and see for yourself.
Food was great, service was fine, but the place was really dirty in the dining room and the bathrooms. Kind of took away my appetite.

We live not even 10 min fro this location. Been craving the bacon mac n cheese balls so my hubby went and got me some and a Avocado BLT.  Can you say GROSSSSSS...We had the balls in the anne arundelmal location and they were AMAZING. Here they were burnt and bitter.  The BLT had noooo bacon. I love avocado and BLT's andthis was nasty.  I don't give bad reviews but we are HIGHLY disappointed
If there was an option for a 1/2 a star, that would be at best this location deserves. Service is horrible and the food is mediocre... Only go if this place offers free food!

It's close to my office that's why I got the giftcard and eat the food here. First time there, there are at least 5 wait staff around but no one come to my table. Second time,I ordered the lunch pairing 1/2 hour before I picked up, when I arrived, nothing is prepared, no one apoligized. third time, lady picked up the phone told me I can't order for togo must dined there (never heard of any place, can't order for togo and I ordered the same thing for togo before),after I tried to confirmed, lady picked up the phone and said I can. Wow wow wow, after I finished the giftcard, will never go back.....

Courteous servers.  I think they mean well but I get the impression they would rather be anywhere else but here.  Except for Jazmine from Torrance, she is awesome. Prepare to wait about 10 minutes for a cocktail.  Not the servers' fault.  But still. It's the ONLY place around and that really sucks.  This is a prime location for competition! Fridays.  It is what it is.  Meh.

This TGIF used to be a decent location for dinner but during renovations their service has greatly declined. It took 30 minutes to wait when there was nobody ahead of us and plenty of seats around. The waiter apologized for the wait but we waited 45 minutes before getting up and leaving because they have not even brought us our drinks yet.

I live closer to this location than the one in Rockville - the Rockville location is sooo much better when it comes to their operation. I come here at least once a month to take advantage of either a monthly promo or to use up my stripes points. Environment: Came here for lunch and dinner. Lunch is good because you'll be able to find parking. Dinner time weekdays or weekends (anytime after 5pm) good luck on finding parking. This place is always packed for dinner so expect to wait 10 minutes or more. Service: Rule of thumb: you know you have a great server, if your water glass is never empty for more than 5 minutes. If your glass has been empty for more than 5 minutes, then do not expect much from your server. Getting great service at this location is like the holy grail, a crap shoot. The reason this place is packed because the service is slow ... i do not know if its the kitchen's fault or the server, but it is slow which is why they do not have a high turn-over on tables. Do not come here super hungry, even the apps and water takes too long to get to your table. Food: nothing to complain - it is tasty. If this place tighten up on their operation, this could be so much better than the one in Rockville. Avoid coming here during Kids Night, trust me.
Wish I could put no stars. This place sucks. Don't waste your gas money getting here. Staff looks drunk. Food is cold and presentation horrid. McDonald's is better.

All I can say is WOW. Terrible service. it took over 1 hour to get our food. The server (Dominque) was weeded the entire time in a 3 table section. After 30 mins he told us the kitchen made a mistake so we have to wait for our food to be cooked again. Man up and never blame the kitchen when u clearly forgot to ring in our food. This is the second time this has happened at this joint. Long story short I will never return to any Fridays if that is the standard the teach. The manager never once came to the table untill I had to get up and search for him. Shoulda went next door to chick filet.

We ordered our drinks first then our entrees after. Before he left to put the orders in, I asked him if he could make separate checks for 9 people. He said okay. We got our drinks around 5 minutes later which wasn't bad considering how busy they were. And we got our food maybe around 30-40 minutes later. I got their Jack Daniels Burger, Medium Rare with fries and JD sauce. I also got the Whiskey Cake with a shot of Baileys for dessert. My brother got the Oreo cake which I had a bite of. Everybody else got whatever they got and for the most part enjoyed their meals. The burger was flavorful and even when the burger was well done :( it was still tender. Just not really juicy. The fries were pretty good until you dip it in the Jack Daniels sauce and they were even better! The dessert was good too. When you get your spoon and get a little bit of everything then consuming the delicious mess into your belly; from the cold ice cream to the warm and fluffy toffee cake smothered by the alcohol and fudge. I guess he was either lazy to make them all separate or he didn't have time or what but it took us like 20 minutes just to handle the check efficiently. We had some Math Majors in the group and it was tough for them to do the math between 12 people. I should have taken a star off for that BUT it didn't take the fun away because while we were waiting, we all were just having a good time. So Mr. Hola guy, you were lucky this time! :) Out of a 275 dollar bill, he got a 70 dollar tip. I was too busy having fun that I didn't realize the decor of the place, the little specs of food under the table on the floor or how they got some of our orders mixed up. It didn't take the fun out of my experience there, mostly because of the people I was with. But either way, this place was good.

Meaning, if you have approx 30 people in the bar area, and ALL 30 seem to know each other by first name, including the manager, there is something wrong. Friday's though?  It's not a dive, and how do you get so friendly with patrons that look to barely be over 21 (questionable).  Following a fight, this lends me to believe that week in week out, these same folks are at Friday's.  - because the manager allowed the other patrons (ones that seem to not start the fight, but took pleasure in jumping in to throw punches and kicks, to stay in the restaurant.  I feel all involved parties should have been asked to leave immediately. Get the negative vibe out and show that crap will not be tolerated, regardless of fault.  - because after the fight and all had cleared (11pm), the doors were still open like nothing happened, and all we saw were more MFing young a$$ dudes coming in. I feel the doors should have been locked at this time especially 1045-11pm. No new customers, and allow existing customers to complete their meal with peace of mind. (You don't really get to relax when you overhear the manager telling his friends/customers that the assailants ran away. One with some common sense would feel a little threatened that someone could double back, re-enter with the intent to cause serious damage or get revenge. Who knows? But lock the f'ing door.  - finally, because we will never go back. It's a shame too, because it's right up the street from our house.  Their food is consistent and special are ok. They offer music and good people watching.  The shame comes from the lack of authority there and the feeling of a free for all.  - this place needs security just to give the presence of authority. I know anyone that reads this review may be foolish enough to think that race and/or sex strongly influence my review. Noooope, wrong. If that was the case, I would not have returned after a few visits. We have tried to give this place a chance, only to be disappointed with the bullsh*t from the restaurant not being able to get out of its own way.  I will end with this. If you work everyday for your money, have love for people, and enjoy the simpler or fancier things in life...avoid this place. If you are a b*tcha$$ and a low rent simpleton. This place is for you. I think the rockville location is better in the taste of food.  The servers at this location are slow and unattentive. They are friendly when they are present. The place wasnt even that busy and i dont even understand what takes the servers this long to come and check on their tables . Theyre probably in the back texting on their damn phones like most of the servers these days. Its so sad these places have come down in customer service and they wonder why they get tipped so crappy.

Service is poor and very slow. Went here on a Monday evening around 8pm to get a quick bite to eat and watch the game with a friend. We sat in the bar area and had to wait 15 minutes before anyone even greeted us. The staff did apologize but it took 25 minutes for our appetizers to come out and then another 20 minutes for out entrees when we order both at the same time. When our appetizers arrived we did not have any plates, utensils, or napkins. When I asked for them. We were told to wait and nothing came. So I asked another serve. At the end we waited 25 minutes for our check. When we got the check, we gave him our credit card and then we had to wait another 10 minutes.  There are only 2 servers working the bar area with 2 bartenders. All of them were too busy to even acknowledge if our table needed anything. I have never been so disappointed in a place before until now.

I hate this location. One of the worst managed restaurants in all of creation. They never bring the entire table's food out at the same time, even routinely take your food to someone else who ordered the same item. This just happened again, this time to my insulin dependent diabetic wife, who had already taken her insulin. After telling us twice thy where working on it, a lie, the manager finally came out to give us free stuff. Woohoo. Free stuff from a terrible restaurant. No thanks. Wasn't busy when we got here. Just horrible incompetence from the servers on up. Stay away.

Our server  David was very nice, but didn't communicate very well. You could tell that he was coming by to check to see if our food had come, and was getting frustrated that it hadnt. He wouldnt say anything to us,he'd just stare. It took about 35 minutes to get our food. Which wouldn't  have been so bad had he told us that he forgot to put it in, or that the kitchen was behind on orders. Which couldn't have been the case since the table who came next to us came 20 minutes after we ordered got the appertizer not to shortly before we recieved our meals. And there entree a few minutes later. I can't say it was to terrible, because like I said he was very nice. But still that is an unacceptable wait time for any restaurant, expecially if it wasn't  that busy.

Worst TGI Fridays in the country.!!!  It's a shame that a business that has majority black customers and a majority black staff is allowed to operate in this manner.  THe TGI cooperation should really take over this store.  I really believe this place has the worst service in the country.  Got seated and no one ever came over to take my order.  This store is in shambles, but it stays busy because there is nowhere else to eat and get a drink in the area.

As much as I don't like writing bad reviews I feel like they deserved one. I went on a Friday night, I knew it would be busy but that was not the problem. Not only did it take them forever to bring me my food, it also took them forever to get my order right. I had originally ordered the Jack Daniels steak(I asked for medium) and STEAMED shrimp with jasmine rice and broccoli as my sides. When I got my food the first thing I noticed was that they had given me fried shrimp instead of steamed, the second thing I noticed was that there were gross looking brown spots all over my broccoli which I've heard is still safe to eat but who would want to? The third thing I noticed is that my steak was over well done. I called for the waiter to come back and explained to him my concerns and seemed as though he had an attitude. He bought my food back about 20 minutes later and I still had the same problem with the steak and the broccoli. I ended up just ordering a completely different meal because they couldn't seem to get it right. I've been here about 6 times and this is the only time I've had any problems... Very disappointing

I have a soft place in my heart for this place. It started when I was in college and they had Karaoke Wednesdays. I became a regular and enjoy the holidays that are basically a reunion for anyone who went to high school in the area. I suggest sitting at the bar, chatting it up, and VOILA! Friday's food is Friday's food so what you get is a regular, no hassle place to meet up with your friends....especially for drinks. To management: please bring back Karaoke!

I'm going to document the whole experience here... because every visit is worse than the previous one. When we arrive it's totally packed, somehow, despite what many religious belief systems, statistics, human conventions and basic standards of taste might suggest.  And every time it feels like an insult, just being here waiting around for service.  On occassion the food hits a nice comforting sub-standard mark that TGIF is know for, but this place takes ghetto fab in Silver Spring to levels you might not see unless you take a trip to Hotlanta.

So. ...I go to Friday's all the time but tonight I am not impressed with this location.   I walked in and the hostess tried to seat me in an area that was clearly dirty. The table wasn't wiped and the floor wasn't swept.  When I said something she tried to laugh it off.   I asked to sit in another part of the reataurant and she said it was closed but offered another section.   While sitting waiting for my food they seated at least 4 parties in the section that was closed...smh.  the server was great and the food was the normal TGI standard.  One more thing.  The music was waaaaaaaay too loud. I sat in a far place away from bar and could barely hear myself think let alone talk comfortably.

Pretty much as expected, that's what chains are about.  Sat in the bar.  Cons: Music was a bit loud and shall we say not aimed at my particular demographic. Portion sizes were not generous but not quite small enough to be called stingy. Cheesecake was unexceptional, whipped cream layer was as thick as the actual filling. Pros: service was cordial, bartender was glad to show me the daily drink specials, including a solid mojito for $3. Steak was cooked exactly as ordered with a good sear. Cole slaw was crisp with a nice creamy dressing. Plenty of parking. Plenty of TVs with varied stations.

We have been in a few times and have had a solid experience each time. As a chain location, there is little that can be said about the atmosphere or menu that isn't obvious. While the staff is friendly, the kitchen is slow no matter the day of the week or time of day you go.

The service was absolutely horrible we waited 15 minutes just to wait for a server to show up at our table and it took us 30 minutes to get a table even when the host said 5 minutes and there were open tables everywhere

The food was decent - we enjoyed the steaks and mahi mahi. However, service was incredibly slow at this location! Our waitress took a long time to bring our drinks and it easily took 15 minutes for her to bring our check after we asked for it. And I don't think it was just our waitress - a lot of the staff seemed confused and a lot of people were just standing around.

The reason I would not recommend this restaurant to a friend has nothing to do with the service or with the skill of the kitchen staff.  They did the best they could do with the menu provided to them. I have not visited a TGI Fridays in many years, and I doubt I'll visit again in the near future. My memory of the menu includes large, flavor filled burgers with excellent toppings, steaks that did not need to hide under sweet sticky glazes, and a pleasant atmosphere. Based on yesterday's visit, only the pleasant atmosphere remains.  My burger was dry and crumbly, and was topped with an overly salty pepperoni marinara sauce which I had to remove. My son's steak- ordered without sauce- was also dry. While this is partly because he ordered it medium well, he's eaten many steaks cooked to that temperature that maintain their flavor. I was thankful that I'd ordered the green bean fries, and my son came home and made himself a bowl of soup. This visit was a good reminder for me that I am not the target demographic, and that a menu based around foods that taste good with a cold beer are not my preference.  The burgers I miss were a build your own concept. I remember having a nice list of available toppings, and I was able to choose four. TGI Fridays was the first restaurant where I could reliably order guacamole for my burger, so I did.  Guacamole, black beans, sautéed onions, and bacon. This was 30 years ago and I still remember begging my family to eat at your restaurants when we spotted them during our travels.  I'd love to see a pared down portion of the menu that did not depend so heavily on sauces and party tricks. I see that they have brought back a build your own toppings list, and so I will keep my fingers crossed that it will stick around long enough for me to try it if I should visit a TGI Fridays again.

Only sit in the bar from now on. Dining room service has never been that good before. The bar area servers and bartenders actually are near your table more often for refills or if you need anything. Will be coming back again.

If you looking for a chill spot and really "don't do clubs" this is a nice alternative. Good music, good drink prices... what more can you ask for? There are drink specials everyday of the week all day.  By the way I think this is the only Fridays location that does the ICE WATER which is pretty much a long island with no sour mix or coke topped with Verdi.  Tastes like water with lime and it is sure to make you feel some type of way. lol. Will be back like I always am.

My server was great! My vegetables were overcooked and the margarita was definitely not worth the money youspend (very watered down with no punch). The ribs were tasty. It's not a place I'd go back to if in the area. I'd most likely try somewhere else first.

Nice waitress but she couldn't make up for the lackluster kitchen staff. They left the sausage off of my Smokehouse stack which led to a debate between the waitress and the cook. In the end she brought me cold sausage in a bowl. I requested one of the three on duty managers - no one showed. Skip this place.

The 2 stars is because I had a pretty good waiter, the wait wasn't that long and California Club was tasty. I came to the restaurant to redeem my Give me stripes points reward.  I received 100 points and found a selection that was exactly 100 points but for some reason when I tried to redeem the 100 points, the app indicated that I didn't have enough points.  Clearly I did have the adequate amount of points and asked for management.  Sadly they were very confused and exercised poor management skills because they acted like it wasn't their problem.  - one said I needed 100 more points other said that's the app problem.   I just selected one of my lower point rewards for lunch.  The issue is even if this is a franchise, this location is still the face of TGIFridays.  They can do better - I think it was within managements power to honor my 100 point reward. I spent $$$ to get to this reward and I didn't have to spend my  money at this location or restaurant chain.
Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta is reallllly good I decided to order take out food was ready no wait
Went there last night and we had pretty bad service.  Waited over 20 minutes for drinks and almost an hour for our food.  Worst part was them bringing our entree before the appetizers.  I was done.
Your average Friday's, nothing super to mention. Very convenient for a family last minute outing. Serving decent. Drinks taste like water. All and all I was satisfied.

This restaurants service is way to slow and the staffs attitudes needs adjusting. When I  asked to speak with the manager, he nrver came to the table.  It is as if he cared less about me the customer.  It took 26 minutes just to receive luke warm appetizers with clold soup and then we had to wait longer for our main course.   This is my first and last visit to this establishment.   Eill not recommend this restaurant or its service to anyone.

Worst run TGI Fridays I've ever been too.  The staff looks for direction and not one manager is on the floor.  We sat next to two dirty tables for over an hour.  Our server wasn't at fault, he was inexperienced.  We actually saw two parties come in and leave because no one greeted them, because no one was at the front desk.  We layer leaned there were three managers on duty 4/11/16. Worst experience and last time I'll ever spend money at this location.  Piss Poor!

I travel on a regular basis for my job and go to many restaurants.   I recently went to the TGI's in Silver Springs Maryland.  I always sit at the bar when going out to eat and did the same at Silver Springs.  The bar servers were very friendly and did a good job.  But with that said, I have never seen a bar station so filthy.  It ruined the whole dinner experience and I would say they are lucky health inspectors have not visited recently.  It looks as though it hasn't been cleaned in years.  The floor was wet with many, many pieces of napkins, papers, etc. on the floor.  The glass windows on the coolers looked like they haven't been cleaned in decades.  You can see water marks on all the cabinets I guess when they must quickly mop behind the bar.  The counters behind the bar are dusty and have so much dirt you can tell it is not one nights worth of not cleaning.  I noticed the plastic pourers that hold the drink mixes and they were so old and dirty thank God I was drinking beer!  I noticed they ran out of one of the drink mixes and they just took the old one, no washing or even rinsing out and poured some more mix.   Bottom line I don't complain much but I thought you should know how bad this bar station area looks.  I would think twice about going into another Friday's after this episode.  The weird thing I didn't notice (not that I looked hard) anywhere else in the building that looked dirty.

Its been a while since I had been to this restaurant and now I remember why, the service SUCKS. In the past I had gone for lunch or for an early dinner and the service had been ok at best. Tonight I went around 7pm for dinner. What a mistake! I sat in the bar and waited 1 hour & 15 min to receive my first cocktail which I had ordered the very first time my server came by to introduce himself. I had also asked for a channel change since 5 TVs were on the same channel, that never occurred. Lots of promises, never any response. I received my order of food about 15 min after my cocktail was delivered (now had waited 1 hour & 30 minutes to receive it) but the person I was dining with NEVER RECEIVED HIS MEAL. I felt sorry for him and shared my meal since he was starving. The food itself, I ordered the Mahi Mahi with salad and mashed potatoes, was good while we were eating it. Then I made the mistake of asking for another cocktail, yep, another 30 minutes went by before it was received. We were so disgusted, when our server finally delivered my drink, we gave up on his food & asked for the check which we received another 15 minutes later. Our server never noticed he didn't get his food. I had wanted ice water to drink, margarine for my mashed potatoes & extra napkins, but forget it, those are luxuries at this restaurant which obviously were not eligible. We paid cash so we could get the heck out of there & buy some food for him elsewhere.  The prices aren't exactly cheap either. My entree was $20 and each of my cocktails were $11 a piece. The serving sizes are small. Its just a basic meal with poor service. If you want a enjoyable dinner without stress, I suggest you go somewhere else.

location: South Jordan, Salt Lake City, UT
review: Traveling, so I stopped in for a quick bite to eat and got just that. The food was decent.

I'm just so sorry that nothing has been done about the EXTREMELY POOR SERVICE that this location offers. The food here is good. The drinks here are good. The staff SUCKS.  Upon our entrance, the "greeter" barely made eye contact much less opened her mouth. HELLO THIS IS YOUR JOB NOT MINE.  I felt like I had to pry the words out of her mouth.  Fast forward to the part where we waited by a few dirty tables in the bar area for 10 minutes and then just decided to sit at one hoping someone ANYONE would just glance in our direction. Maybe a smile would be nice. But no. Every single staff member that passed did and said nothing FOR ANOTHER 25 MINUTES. We're on our way out now because we've had enough and  LO AND BEHOLD! We run into the manager on the way out.. so I give her a piece of my mind. Her solution is to offer for me to go back inside to smile up in front of the same servers who just ignored us for almost 30 minutes.. NO THANKS. Zero stars if this were an option. Not coming back unless it's under new management. You would think service would be great considering its in a popular area. Take your money elsewhere!

Ordered a California chicken club to go. Took over an hour to come out and when it did the order was wrong, they overcharged me, then disappeared to "fix it". I waited another five minutes and decided if they mess up that badly with an order I don't want to risk food poisoning. Would not recommend going here for any reason.
Worst service I have ever had. My girlfriend and I go for drinks and apps. Drinks took 27 mins and our apps came out before our drink. Don't waste your money or time.

The service was the worst we've ever received. We walk in and there is no one to seat us so we walk over to a server ask if we should seat ourselves he said we can but not in his station and points to the next one. We go sit at a booth there and a gentleman comes over and says this area non serviceable and seats us at the servers station (where we were asked not to sit). The gentleman (I think he was the manager) comes over and asks what we'd like to order, we explain that we've been sitting here for a while but we never got menus- we eventually order appetizers and don't get any plates or napkins and then he was no where to be found to ask for plates so we ate on the napkin that was wrapped around the cutlery. We felt like we were inconveniencing them by being there. We won't be back that's for sure.

The only reason they are getting 3 stars is because of Rob, my bartender, and the food is as it always is - good. My boyfriend and I came here to watch the Warriors and OKC game, but unfortunately management does not work to satisfy customer needs. Almost every single person here wants to watch the game and although the the sound of the game is on, they are playing Pandora for whatever odd reason and the music is much louder than the sound of the game. Maybe if management would work on PLEASING the CUSTOMERS, they wouldn't have 2 stars. They have been failing at this for years, new management has come and gone, yet they continue to fail. All you have to do is make your customer happy. Trust me, I know. I was a waitress before at a restaurant, which lived for making every customer happy!

What can I say about this place? Well being that I live close by, it's more just out of convenience. Having been coming here for years, I can attest to the decline in service over the years. Again, it's close by and easy to stop in and just grab a drink. I won't necessarily recommend it for a special occasion or anything like that. I tend to sit in the bar when I'm here and even when it's slow, I've found the service horrendous.  During my last visit, I was sitting in the bar and wanted to partake in the $12 dine and drink deal which I had recently done at this very location and in the bar. Well this time around, I was told they no longer honor that deal in the bar, only in the dining area. What foolishness is that? Ok fine, we'll move to the dining area, no problem. I ordered the petite sirloin with two sides and a drink for $12 (yes not a bad deal, right?!) However, my steak was well done and I had ordered it medium. This is not the first time I've experienced this here. Well since they can't un-cook it, I tried to eat as much of it as I could but I felt like I was chewing leather. I'm so serious!!  Good thing, I wasn't starving, but still... I have stopped by here late on a Saturday night and it was a lil turnt (in a good way!!) so maybe that's what they're good for! Late night drink after a night out somewhere else.

Went during lunch, had to clean our own table off. Waited about 20 minutes before a waiter came to take our drink order. Took another 10 minutes for me to get my non alcoholic drink and everyone else had there drinks already. Then it has taken so long to get our food we ended up getting it to go. Worst TGI Fridays ever. I really didn't want to give it one star but had to select one.

It's alright ... We. Sat ourselves in the bar. Booth and our waiter arrived quickly.  He was friendly . And the food was actually good and drinks! They play great music as well. when we arrived to Friday's no one was at the front . So we sat at the bar . Last time I came to Friday's the dinning area was closed . Only the bar was opened and every seat was filled . How do you expect to have business if you closed the whole dinning area . So I left . But this time the experience was better .

I've eaten at Fridays in other areas and I would not go back to this one. Our waitress was hard to find, and would start walking away when we were asking for something since she was always in a hurry. The food was not as good as other locations either. I enjoy eating the appetizer specials they have, but today was not enjoyable. The potato skin appetizer came and the potatoes were extremely bruised, I just ate the cheese and bacon off the top. The cheese sticks were still solid in the middle and not cooked fully. Customer service isn't the best, food wasn't as good as it is at other Fridays, so I won't be going back.

My husband, I and our friend came here on Friday night around midnight. We were starving as hell. And we were ready to spend money since we were about to order 3 entrees, 3 appetizers and drinks and I would def force them for a dessert as well. A nice greeters/host met us with smile and being polite. No complaints about them. We got seated to the booth. And then we were ready to order. 5 min. No one coming. So our friend went to the host stand and asked if anyone gonna take our order. So the hostess came she apologized and said that they are "kinda busy, but she can take our drinks order". And we are starving. And the section where we were seated was empty. Only us and 1 more table which is finishing up. It's still a mystery for me how our server is busy? Same as other 5 servers passed us by (I get it it's not your section) but they didn't seem to run around like they are busy just walking. Same as I would say it's not a full house it's 60% capacity. So after all that time I would say 15 min. I have decided to put a timer on just for curiousity how long it will take? And guess what I see, the  server walking to the door, the host tells her to take our order and she (server) points at us with her hand and makes a facial expression like she doesn't give a damn about us, I looked her in her eyes and she saw that I see her, she takes off her apron and walking out. I understand it's midnight. Maybe she was working a double idk. But since I am working in very busy restaurant myself I know how it is. So even if you don't feel like working on Friday. And don't wanna take a table. At least don't stand in the middle of the floor and don't point out at the customers! Especially when they see you! This is so disrespectful! I am from New York and honestly when my family (all the way from Russia) comes visit and we go to stupid times sq. and then to eat at Friday's, the service over there is way faster, on a Times sq., the busiest tourist place in the world. Mb it's not that clean and shiny on a times sq. But in term of being really busy but still serving fast and with no attitude they are def. win! My advice, Please fire this girl cuz she is obviously not happy with the job she does. So give her a favor and end her torture. Horrible experience and it's ridiculous that we end up being hungry cuz of one stupid person who doesn't wanna do the job. We left, my timer was showing 10min. So 25min no one took our order and the server went out mb to smoke or idk. Mind me - we always tip 20%. Her lost. Peace.

I'm giving this place a high rating because of the service. This is my go to spot if I'm in the area and need some good drink options. Lets be honest its TGIF food its not going to blow you away. But, with all their rewards and promotions on food you won't be spending a lot. I recently stopped by with some friends and ordered the endless apps. They make each person pay the $10 for the apps promotion. We had the BBQ chicken flatbread, pot stickers, fried green beans, mozzarella sticks, and boneless chicken in Jack Daniel's sauce. Food took a while to come out about 15-25 mins every time we needed a re order on apps so I recommend re ordering every time they bring out the food. Staff here is always friendly and attentive. With plenty of parking in the lot you won't have any trouble finding a spot.

I've been to this place serval times and it seems like the service is getting worst. When you ask questions about drinks the bartenders make it a point to say "you cannot send it back." The first time it happened to me, I was EXTREMELY confused because my intention wasn't to send the drink back, I had a question about the drink menu. It's almost like they assume the worst from there customers. Did they feel like I didn't have the money to pay for the drink?? As a customer felt insulted.  Another incident the waiter attempted to refuse my friend service because they had a driving alcohol restriction on there license. The waiter was so rude and it was clear that she got it from by her discourteous manger, Herman.  He claimed that its Fridays policy, but could not display this policy anywhere in writing or explain it efficiently so it was atleast half way believable. We literally had to show them the Maryland.Gov website and explain the license (which is something they should inform employees before work the bar area) before my friend or our party could get any type of service. After the misunderstanding there was no apology from manager or server of their incompetence. Instead, they repaid us by late food and few to none visits to the table. She pretty much just made us feel unwelcome for the rest of the night. So much so I inquired several times if it was possible that we could change waiters.  If I was to give them the benefit of the doubt, maybe not serving to driving alcohol restriction ID is in there policy. And that's okay if that's their policy! My critic however is on how it was poorly handled. One person having an ID issue should not effect the entire tables service. The employees training on customer service or conflict resolution was unapparent. It was so bad I had to step outside to gather my thoughts on what the real issue was. I was so disgusted during my past visit that I couldn't order anything past a glass of water, which is nothing like me.  My impression is that this location has an discriminatory undertone. They will go above and beyond to make you feel like an unvalued customer. This place gets one star because usually when I go I enjoy the music. Probably won't go back until they change management. I will be looking on Yelp for updates.

I come here a lot since its conveniently located near my job. I must say the service isn't that great. It seems like every time I come something always goes wrong. This last experience just topped everything. I came in with a friend and sat down at the tables by the bar. We came in and already knew what we wanted. We were greeted by one person who informed us he was not our server, and there in the middle of changing shifts but he could get our drinks. Ok fine we ordered our water and waited... And waited...(20 mins later) we had to stop a server passing by and ask them if they could take our order or get our server. The first server comes back and takes our order and says it will be out shortly. 30 mins passed and we still hadn't even gotten our apps yet. At that point we were already annoyed.  Finally our apps and entree come out and everything that could be wrong was wrong. The pasta was dry, like Sierra desert dry. The appetizer sampler that we got was blah. The pretzels were dripping in grease, mozzarella sticks were soggy from the pretzel grease and the potato skins were as crunchy as potato chips.   We informed our server who then got his manager. Manager took the apps back and took it off the check and remade the pasta and offered us dessert on the house. I accepted the offer and got the brownie obsession (just a warm brownie and ice cream) I thought it would come out quickly but that took 20 mins as well.  I don't know what was going on on this particular day but I just couldn't believe it.  Not sure when and if ill be back to this location

My husband refuses to download the Yelp app because he is a service industry worker but I am uploading the same complaint he made to the Corporate office. Also I would give this review zero stars but Yelp doesn't allow that.  " I want to start this out by saying that I'm a 6 yr veteran of this industry, a former employee and I have never complained about service until now, because I understand things happen. This evening I came into Friday's with my wife and cousin to have some drinks and appetizers in the bar area. After a very stressful day. First, all of the available tables were dirty or had glassware stacked on them. I had  to ask our server who never introduced herself or I would name her, to wipe off our table, she still proceeded to place the menus on top of the dirty table. We asked for waters at first and she brought us waters with no ice, when it was 90+ degrees outside. I assumed the ice machine the broken because when we ordered our bar drinks she asked if we wanted ice. Had to ask for ice in our luke warm waters she brought. Our bar drinks never came after over 20 minutes of waiting. We see our server making other drinks and she brought us app plates but no drinks. No word on where our drinks are, then we see a bartender on her phone and the MOD just walking around nonchalantly. At that  moment we decided to leave. My wife being the attorney she is wanted to speak to the manager. He blew her off and then the server came out, throwing up her hands and yelling at my wife like she had  done something wrong. I have never witnessed such unprofessional behavior at a Friday's or anywhere else for that matter. Now because we love the chain, we are driving 20 more minutes to the next closest location and will never patronize the Silver Spring store again and it is 6 minutes from our home."

Terrible service...waited way to long for water, for drinks and for food.  The manager was no help either!  When time for the check he kept avoiding it, lied to our face and overall...poor, poor customer service!
@TGIFridays worst customer service experience at your tech rd MD location. Considering NEVER going back!

I have been to several different TGI Fridays over the years including this one. Tonight has been the worse experience I've had from the moment I walk in. We had to be waited for 15-25 minutes to get a table for 4 and the restaurant was not busy or full there were plenty of empty tables available. One of my brothers order the endless  appetizers as he always does and we had to wait 20 to 30 minutes between plates. I am not one to leave a review but this not has been horrible. Tonight was very clear that this restaurant is not being ran correctly. Sincerely an extremely frustrated customer.

So I've been here twice for lunch now and the same issues have come through both times. The servers are friendly but not attentive or quick. I can deal with this, it gets busy so it's fine.  My main issue is the speed at which my food arrives. Both times it's taken almost 40min!!! to get my food.  Both times it's wasn't very busy once at 2pm and the day we went at 1pm. Both times it was my chicken dish that held everything up.  Do NOT get the chicken sliders, they are horrible. Just bland breading with super dry chicken inside and fried to extinction. This last time I had the chicken Caesar salad hoping that would be faster. Wrong! Still took forever. It was fine, nothing special and not worth getting again.  If my lunch break was only 30 min I could never eat here. You legitimately need over an hour to get lunch which is absolutely insane. I've concluded that they don't know how to cook chicken. Their beef sliders, fries, mozzarella sticks, shrimp pasta, and pretzels are actually pretty good.  So to summarize, don't order chicken and make sure you have at least an hour to wait for your food.

I see others have had not so good experiences at this place.I guess I've just been lucky.I have been to this Friday's on different occasions throughout the years.I have always either good or just okay service.The food has always come out hot just not the mozzarella sticks.I'm not sure why they always come out lukewarm.I want pipp'in hot mozzarella sticks not cold.

I don't know what to say about this place with out sounding old but this shit was entirely too loud for a restaurant! I was just trying to have a meal not loose my hearing. In a last redemption effort for the restaurant, we moved over to the bar. OMG...prompt service. I have had ok service here but never this bad. Food is fine.
Brittany the server was nice and patient. The salmon salad was not that good.  They play music it was surprised good after work spot for drinks.

Last night I went to have dinner with my fiancé and she had a good burger her meal was great, the endless app wings were great as well as the potato skins. My drinks and food weren't that good. I ordered one of there Hawaii drinks (the blue one) it tasted like ice mixed with coconut juice.. that's it nothing else's, so I ordered a lime margarita and that was better. Still watered down but do able. What I did not enjoy was my 10ounce sirloin jack Daniels steak which I ordered medium by the way, tasted so burned and like charcoal that it wasn't edible. So I just filled myself up with the appetizers and drink. The service was great! I did not catch my waitress name but she was the only one with dreadlocks there, she was great all around as well as the manager she took care of me and my concerns. Overall i did not enjoy the food but I would continue to come back this was the only time out of like the 15 times I've came here I have had this issue.

Horrible. Ordered a sizzling chicken and cheese and received 3 small pieces of chicken with a slice of cheese unmelted on the bottom. Also my Sons boneless chicken were the size of quarters. This is why we don't go to Fridays anymore. Just the last option we had. Yuck- waste of money

Went to lunch with 3 friends and after such a ludicrous scenario, none of us plan to return. I ordered a bottle of Pellegrino or Perrier water - our server was uncertain as to which the restaurant carried. He returned with an open bottle of white wine and 2 glasses! I corrected him so he apologized and removed the wine AND glasses, bringing over a Perrier but no glass from which to drink. I ordered a burger and asked him to swap out the fries for sauteed spinach for which he informed me there would be an up-charge - I approved. A man who I later was informed was the manager (?) brought our entries but mine had the fries but not the spinach so I corrected him - and he said he'd bring the spinach but never returned to our table. When done with my burger I called our server over, explained the missing-spinach scenario for which he apologized, noting that the man who'd brought our entree was the manager! I was eventually served the spinach when my burger was finished. When our bill for $42 arrived (the 20% coupon had been applied) we gave him $60 in cash for lack of the correct amount plus a tip. The server kept the $18 tip and did not return to the table! We asked another server to send over the  manager who never appeared. When ready to leave, one of my friends located our server and asked for our change. One problem after another! A Seinfeld episode? If this is coupon-related than the restaurant should not send them out to customers as the poor service is not worth the discount.

Okay so I try to constantly give this place a try but every time I decide to give this place a try I'm disappointed and nothing has changed. It's always really bad waitress service and the food takes forever to come out. It seems like they are under staffed or not properly trained because it's the same issue everytime. The waitresses are usually always nice which is good but the service is really bad. The last time I went they took forever with our food, also my appetizer came out with our food which makes no sense because we ordered it separately in a decent time frame. Also after receiving our food our waitress was yet to be seen anywhere. In other restaurants when I have asked someone other than our waitress for help I have gotten helped from the person I asked so that is just terrible waitressing. Again the waitresses are polite and friendly but that is not enough, I think this restaurant needs more staff or better trained  staff. This restaurant has good potential because the location and food are good but I decided not to try to give this restaurant another try because I always get disappointed. If I decide to give it another shot it'll probably be in a year. I hope by then they have improved and I can update my review.

This place is one out of two of a kind restaurants in the Maryland Areas . It has a Great wait staff Team and great hospitality . The menu has great variety of food and exotic to regular drinks . The prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is friendly and welcoming . Plus this place has a full bar with exotic Drinks of your desire including sodas and more . This is A kind of place you might like to stop at after a long day . You can sit back relax have a good cooked meal and in the evening on this day enjoy their karaoke night there as well . It also has a full bar to go too there as well . So if you enjoy their karaoke and the good food and Hospitality , then this place is for you . So come on down and enjoy your stay at TGI Fridays .Its an experience you won't forget . They look forward to you coming to visit and have a good time . They hope to see you soon . I loved the karaoke once there and loved having dinner there once and hope to return there someday .
